articles.title: Africa administers less than 2% of global COVID-19 vaccines – WHO - Guardian
articles.description: Africa accounts for less than two per cent of the 690 million COVID-19 vaccines administered globally so far.
articles.content:
(Photo by Eva Marie UZCATEGUI / AFP)
Africa accounts for less than two per cent of the 690 million COVID-19 vaccines administered globally so far.

articles.author: Karen Hofman
articles.title: New research shows South Africa's levy on sugar-sweetened drinks is having an impact - The Conversation Africa
articles.description: The results are in: South Africa’s ground-breaking health promotion levy, introduced in 2018, is working.
articles.content:
Three years ago South Africa introduced Africas first major tax on sugar-sweetened beverages based on grams of sugar. The tax now stands at about 11% of the price per litre.
